intro: Bupleurum exaltatum var. macropodum, commonly known as the large-footed Chinese angelica, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often hollow stems. The plant features compound leaves with serrated margins and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
